title: Fix eye button functionality in tab headers
description:
The eye button in tab headers currently doesn't work properly. It should hide all request parts of the tab pane and only show the response, but currently it only hides part of the request, doesn't change the icon properly, and subsequent clicks don't work.

Root causes identified:
1. App.ts: Eye icon element is created once and never updated when signal changes
2. RequestHTTP.ts: Has subscription logic but uses wrong element references
3. Other request components: Missing proper signal subscriptions and layout updates
4. All components: Need to handle dynamic layout changes when request is hidden
design:
## Implementation Strategy

### Core Principle
Use direct DOM manipulation (no framework) to:
1. Update eye icon when signal changes
2. Toggle request panel visibility 
3. Expand response panel to full width when request is hidden

### Architecture Changes

#### 1. App.ts - Eye Button Icon Update
- Store eye button element reference
- Subscribe to `show_request.sub()` 
- Replace icon SVG on signal change
- Update title text on signal change

#### 2. Request Components - Layout Toggle
Each request component needs:
- Store references to request and response panel elements
- Subscribe to `show_request.sub()` 
- Update parent container layout on signal change:
  - **True (show)**: Split view (request + response)
  - **False (hide)**: Response only (full width)

#### 3. NSplit Component Handling
- Current NSplit creates fixed grid layout
- Need to either:
  - Replace NSplit with conditional layout, OR
  - Hide/show panels within existing NSplit, OR  
  - Use CSS to hide request panel and expand response

### Component-specific Fixes

**High Priority:**
- RequestHTTP.ts: Fix subscription logic and layout
- RequestSQL.ts: Add subscription and layout toggle
- RequestJQ.ts: Add subscription and layout toggle
- RequestMD.ts: Add subscription and layout toggle

**Medium Priority:**
- RequestGRPC.ts: Implement show_request support
- RequestRedis.ts: Implement show_request support
- RequestSQLSource.ts: Add proper subscription

### Implementation Pattern
```typescript
// In each request component's loaded() function:
const requestPanel = /* element */;
const responsePanel = /* element */;

show_request.sub((show) => {
  if (show) {
    // Show split layout
    el.replaceChildren(NSplit(requestPanel, responsePanel));
  } else {
    // Show response only (full width)
    el.replaceChildren(responsePanel);
    responsePanel.style.width = "100%";
  }
});
```

### Testing Strategy
1. Click eye button - icon should toggle
2. Click eye button again - icon should toggle back
3. Request panel should hide/show accordingly
4. Response panel should expand to full width when request hidden
5. All request types should work identically
acceptance_criteria:
1. Eye button icon changes between open/closed eye on click
2. Eye button title updates between "Hide request" and "Show request"
3. Clicking eye button multiple times works correctly
4. When eye is closed, request panel is completely hidden
5. When eye is closed, response panel takes full width
6. When eye is open, split view is restored
7. All request types (HTTP, SQL, JQ, MD, GRPC, Redis, SQLSource) work consistently

title: Fix memory leaks from signal subscriptions not being unsubscribed
description:
The signal subscription system in utils.ts returns an unsubscribe function, but none of the components are calling it. This causes memory leaks when components are destroyed or tabs are closed.

Current issues:
1. Request components (HTTP, SQL, GRPC, JQ, Redis, MD, SQLSource) all call show_request.sub() without storing the unsubscribe function
2. App.ts panelkaFactory subscribes to show_request.sub() without cleanup
3. No unmount/cleanup mechanism exists in the component lifecycle

This needs to be fixed by:
1. Storing unsubscribe functions returned by signal.sub()
2. Calling unsubscribe when components are destroyed/tabs closed
3. Implementing proper cleanup in panelkaFactory
4. Adding unmount methods to all request components
acceptance_criteria: All signal subscriptions have corresponding unsubscribe calls, memory leaks are eliminated when tabs are closed
close_reason: Memory leaks fixed by implementing proper cleanup for signal subscriptions in all request components and panelkaFactory
